3.1. Pystepx base¶

3.1.1. pystepx.pySTEPX – Manager of the GP run¶

Manager of the Genetic Programming Engine. You can control the process by the help of this class.

class pystepx.pySTEPX.PySTEPX(db_path='/tmp/pySTEPX.sqlite', start_from_scratch=True)¶

Genetic Programming Engine Manager.

evolve()¶

Launch the evoluation process.

Parameter:is_sequential – to set if we work sequentially or not.

When False, evolution stops when the requirement is fit. When True, evolution stops after each generation

get_best_individual()¶
Returns the best individual of the whole population
get_db_name()¶
Set the dbname
get_last_generation_number()¶
Returns the actual generation.
sequentially_evolve()¶
Launch the evolution process sequentially. The process stops after each generation. This is a generator returning the best element after each generation
set_adf_ordered(value)¶
Specify if adf must be ordered (prevents infinite loop)
set_crossover_mapping(mapping)¶
Set the crossover mapping
set_crossover_operator(operator)¶
Set the crossover operator
set_db_name(value)¶
Set the dbname
set_endofgeneration(handler)¶
Set the function to call at the end of a generation.
set_evolver(evolver)¶

Set the evolver object of the gp engine.

Parameter:evolver – evolver to use
set_fitness_function(function)¶
Set the fitness function to use
set_functions(functions)¶
Set the functions set
set_mutation_operator(operator)¶
Set the mutation opertor
set_start_from_scratch(value)¶
Set if we need to restart computation from scratch if the database already exists.
set_strongly_typed_crossover_degree(degree)¶
XXX
set_substitute_mutation(value)¶
Sit if we have to do a mutation when crossover fail
set_terminals(terminals)¶
Set the terminal set
set_tree_rules(rules)¶
Set the tree rules

3.1.2. pystepx.basevolver – Optimized evolving¶

Contains code which can be compiled by cython

This module contains the methods to start and finish a complete evolutionary run. The present version can run strongly-typed Koza-based GP using tournament selection.

class pystepx.baseevolver.BaseEvolver¶

Evolver object. Launch the fitness computing on the trees. Launch the next generation compatutation process.

param popsize:size of the population

root_node: specify the root node and its arity (nb of children). e.g. (0,2,’root’) :param mindepth: min tree depth (at the moment only 2 working) :param maxdepth: max depth of trees in new generation (should be >=3) :param buildmethod: which Koza method is used to build the trees (either ‘AddHalfNode’ or ‘AddFullNode’ or ‘AddGrowNodeMin’ respectively for Ramped Half-n-Half, Full, or Half) :param max_nb_runs: the search will gon on until a maximum number of generations is reached :param fitness_criterion: the search will stop if the fitness found is <= to the ideal fitness :param crossover_prob: probability of crossover (will determine what proportion of the population will be replaced by crossover-generated offsprings) :param mutation_prob: probability of crossover (will determine what proportion of the population will be replaced by mutation-generated offsprings) :param dbname: path to database e.g. r’D:d_workpythongppySTGP_0.51srcpop_db’

SetSubstituteMutation¶
Set if we must substitute mutation
TournamentSelectionEvolveDBPopulation2¶
create a new population of randomly generated trees and write this new generation to a new table of name ‘tab’+generation number in the database.
Parameters:
  • popsize – size of the population
  • maxdepth – max depth of trees in new generation
  • crossover_prob – probability of crossover (will determine what proportion of the population will be replaced by crossover-generated offsprings) :param mutation_prob: probability of crossover (will determine what proportion of the population will be replaced by mutation-generated offsprings) :param con: Connection to database param tablename: name of the database table of the initial population :param tablename2: name of the database table of the next generation
get_best_individual¶

Returns information about the best individual.

@todo use a method in writepop and optimize

get_real_popsize¶
Returns the real popsize
get_tree¶
Return the required tree. :TODO: move this in the right class
is_evolution_ended¶
Look if the evolution is ended, because:
  • the maximum generation is get
  • the fitness is set
load_tree¶
Load the information of the tree
print_end_generation¶

Print if necessary information about the best tree of the generation.

@todo set chosen_one with the tree and not its indice

exception pystepx.baseevolver.CrossoverProbError¶
Exception related to crossover
exception pystepx.baseevolver.EvolutionException¶
Exception held during the evolution process
exception pystepx.baseevolver.MutationProbError¶
Exception related to mutation
exception pystepx.baseevolver.OperatorProbError¶
Exception related to operators
exception pystepx.baseevolver.PopSizeError¶
Exception related to pop size

Classical evolver. Contains code that can be compiled by cython.

class pystepx.evolver.Evolver(popsize=200, root_node=(0, 1, 'root'), min_depth=2, max_depth=8, buildmethod='AddHalfNode', max_nb_runs=100, fitness_criterion=9.9999999999999995e-08, crossover_prob=0.5, mutation_prob=0.48999999999999999, size=7, prob_selection=0.80000000000000004)¶

Evolver object. Launch the fitness computing on the trees. Launch the next generation compatutation process.

XXX add probability of crossover points XXX add the choice for selection (tournament, elitism, ...)

@param popsize: size of the population root_node: specify the root node and its arity (nb of children). e.g. (0,2,’root’) @param mindepth: min tree depth (at the moment only 2 working) @param maxdepth: max depth of trees in new generation (should be >=3) @param buildmethod: which Koza method is used to build the trees (either ‘AddHalfNode’ or ‘AddFullNode’ or ‘AddGrowNodeMin’ respectively for Ramped Half-n-Half, Full, or Half) @param max_nb_runs: the search will gon on until a maximum number of generations is reached @param fitness_criterion: the search will stop if the fitness found is <= to the ideal fitness @param crossover_prob: probability of crossover (will determine what proportion of the population will be replaced by crossover-generated offsprings) @param mutation_prob: probability of crossover (will determine what proportion of the population will be replaced by mutation-generated offsprings) @param dbname: path to database e.g. r’D:d_workpythongppySTGP_0.51srcpop_db’
Run(verbose=True, print_tree=False)¶
Launch the evolution. Use the sequential way.
SetSubstituteMutation¶
Set if we must substitute mutation
TournamentSelectionEvolveDBPopulation2¶
create a new population of randomly generated trees and write this new generation to a new table of name ‘tab’+generation number in the database.
Parameters:
  • popsize – size of the population
  • maxdepth – max depth of trees in new generation
  • crossover_prob – probability of crossover (will determine what proportion of the population will be replaced by crossover-generated offsprings) :param mutation_prob: probability of crossover (will determine what proportion of the population will be replaced by mutation-generated offsprings) :param con: Connection to database param tablename: name of the database table of the initial population :param tablename2: name of the database table of the next generation
get_best_individual¶

Returns information about the best individual.

@todo use a method in writepop and optimize

get_real_popsize¶
Returns the real popsize
get_tree¶
Return the required tree. :TODO: move this in the right class
is_evolution_ended¶
Look if the evolution is ended, because:
  • the maximum generation is get
  • the fitness is set
load_tree¶
Load the information of the tree
print_end_generation¶

Print if necessary information about the best tree of the generation.

@todo set chosen_one with the tree and not its indice

run_sequentially(verbose=True, print_tree=True)¶
Run the evolution and stops yield each generation. The process never ends. It’s up to the caller to ends its.
